page.title: 01GAZETTE P.ONE, FARNBOROUGH
page.content: {This area of Farnborough,}Cove, Hawley and Frimley encloses a variety of land usage.Originally an area of scrub land open heaths and farmland watered by Cove Brook & the River Blackwater. {Cove Manor}was mentioned in the Domesday Book and lay near the small hamlet of Cove.Its surrounding meadows and open land are now covered in modern housing estates,still being rapidly erected today.Commuters to {London}have a fast service to{Waterloo and many local people use this service. Travel has also been facilitated by access to the{M3}at the large motorway junction near Frimley.Another reason for the rapid growth in population is is the expansion of light industry and expanding{computer industries } based in the Farnborough area.
